skill.name: api-route-design
skill.description:
Use when designing RESTful API endpoints in FastAPI or Python projects.
Triggers for: creating GET/POST/PUT/DELETE endpoints, request validation with Pydantic,
response formatting with JSON schemas, status code selection, pagination, filtering,
or sorting parameters.
NOT for: GraphQL APIs, WebSocket handlers, or non-RESTful endpoints.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with a simple validation script. No network access, no sensitive data access, no dangerous code execution patterns. The verify.py script only reads files in its own directory and validates SKILL.md format using standard library.

content.user_title: Design RESTful API endpoints in FastAPI
content.value_statement: This skill helps you design and implement RESTful APIs with proper validation, response formatting, and correct HTTP semantics. It provides patterns for common endpoints like CRUD operations, pagination, filtering, and sorting.
actual_capabilities: Create RESTful endpoints with proper HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE)
Implement request validation using Pydantic models with field constraints
Design pagination, filtering, and sorting query parameters
Format consistent JSON responses with proper status codes
Define URL naming conventions and nested resource patterns
Generate OpenAPI documentation with summaries and descriptions
limitations: Does not cover GraphQL API implementation
Does not include authentication or authorization logic
Does not provide database connection or ORM integration

use_cases.title: Build CRUD endpoints
use_cases.description: Create standard Create, Read, Update, Delete endpoints with proper validation and status codes.

use_cases.title: Design consistent APIs
use_cases.description: Establish URL naming conventions, response formats, and error handling patterns across projects.

use_cases.title: Add pagination support
use_cases.description: Implement paginated list endpoints with skip, limit, and has_more indicators.

prompt_templates.title: Basic endpoint
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a GET endpoint to fetch a single resource by ID with 404 handling.

prompt_templates.title: List with filters
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a list endpoint with pagination, filtering by status, and sorting options.

prompt_templates.title: Create with validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a POST endpoint with Pydantic validation for required fields and positive amount constraints.

prompt_templates.title: Update operations
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement a PATCH endpoint for partial updates using optional Pydantic fields.

output: Returns user data with 200 status code
Uses path parameter validation for integer user_id

best_practices: Use plural nouns for collection endpoints (/users not /user)
Return 201 for POST creates, 204 for DELETE operations
Include pagination metadata with skip, limit, and has_more fields
anti_patterns: Returning 200 for not found instead of 404

faq.question: Does this skill work with Flask or Django?
faq.answer: Patterns are FastAPI-specific but HTTP semantics apply to any Python web framework.

faq.question: What are the pagination limits?
faq.answer: Default limit is 100 with max of 1000 enforced through Pydantic validation.

faq.question: How do I integrate authentication?
faq.answer: Use @jwt-auth skill for Depends(get_current_user) patterns shown in examples.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill only generates code patterns. It never accesses your files or data.

faq.question: Why is my endpoint returning 422?
faq.answer: 422 errors come from Pydantic validation failures. Check your input types and required fields.

faq.question: How is this different from api-client?
faq.answer: api-route-design creates servers while api-client consumes APIs. They are complementary.
